channel.title: Kick Timer
channel.description:
How do i make it so when i kick the player he doesn't just dc and come right back on. I want to make it so he stays offline for like 30 seconds. And if you know client side how can i make it so it says "You were kicked for 1 minute please try again in 60 seconds". I have my own client so yeah...Thanks.
~eric

item.title: Kick Timer
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

Ok, i spelled one word wrong… i was talking about using variables to keep track of which users have been kicked and if they tried to log in, each time someone logged in, it would check the ip for a match with the ban variable. Also i admit i didn’t know that you could send a frame saying they are banned for a minute from the server side.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick Timer
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

You can't unless you do allot of coding with variables
I said you didnt know what you were talking about because of those first ten words. Should be eleven because alot is two words. ;)

And its not hard webbsta.
sendFrame126(“You were kicked for 1 minute please try again in 60 seconds”, theIDHERE);
sendFrame246(“You were kicked for 1 minute please try again in 60 seconds”, theIDHERE);
One of the two. TheIDHERE can be found in a few tutorials.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick Timer
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

I know what I’m talking about, do you really think he knows how to send a packet… and by trying to explain to him how he needs to solve it he will now probably go searching off to find stuff about sending packets and it will probably confuse him. i was trying to put it in perspective for him, he won’t be able to do it on his own.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick Timer
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“webbsta, post:2, topic:170049”]…[/quote]You my friend, honestly, have no idea what you are talking about.

@eric owner2, find out how you kick the player. Either right-click or via command, then visit that spot in your code. Find out how it kicks the player, and look for any potential bugs. As for your second question, all you have to do is send a packet (246 I think in this case) to the client with the information you want displayed on your screen. Just find the right spot on the screen to send it to. Mess around with the method sendFrame246(string, int). The 246 might not be correct, because I haven’t looked for a long time.

Read full topic

item.title: Kick Timer
item.dc:creator: @eric_owner2 eric owner2
item.description:
@eric_owner2 wrote:

Ok then. Whats the point of kick?

Read full topic

item.title: Kick Timer
item.dc:creator: @webbsta webbsta
item.description:
@webbsta wrote:

You can’t unless you do allot of coding with variables and stuff but it would take a while to make it, also you won’t be able to adjust anything client side unless you are using your own client because the server simply sends the request to the client, such as if you used a wrong username or password it would send back an error code, not the actual text that is displayed on the client.

Read full topic
